info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:04PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Mecklenburg, west central Union and northeastern York Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Uptown Charlotte, or over Steele Creek, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Matthews, Weddington, Fort Mill, Pineville, Tega Cay and Marvin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
